required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Esophageal Impedance and Manometry Measurements and Dysphagia Symptom Scoring
clinical_study.official_title: Esophageal Impedance and Manometry Measurements and Dysphagia Symptom Scoring

brief_summary.textblock: Comparison of manometry measurements and EndoFlip Balloon measurements in patients with dysphagia and a known esophageal diagnosis

detailed_description.textblock:
Gastrointestinal (GI) motility problems are very common in the general population. Dysphagia, difficulty swallowing, is one of the most common issues in gastroenterology. In many patients, esophageal obstruction is not identified despite workup with upper endoscopy or barium swallow x-ray. Patients are often referred to the Motility Laboratory for evaluation of non-obstructive dysphagia. Transnasal esophageal manometry-impedance is a diagnostic test to measure the pressures and coordination of the esophagus during swallowing. The Endolumenal Functional Lumen Imaging Probe (EndoFLIP) is another instrument used to measure the lumen distensibility of the esophagus and pylorus. Both tests are FDA-approved and are currently being used in clinical practice. However, correlation of the results obtained from these tests with clinical syndromes and symptoms is not clearly understood. Furthermore, the relationship between esophageal impedance-manometry and EndoFLIP results has never been defined.
The primary Aim is to develop a registry of patients undergoing esophageal manometry-impedance and Endoflip from the GI Motility Lab at the IU University Hospital

primary_outcome.description: Compare the distensibility index (mm2/mmHg) of the pylorus at 50 ml distension in patients with postsurgical gastroparesis and compare to patients with idiopathic and diabetic gastroparesis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation between endoflip parameters and gastric scintigraphy
secondary_outcome.description: Correlate distensibility data (cross-sectional area, pressure, distensibility index) with severity of delayed gastric emptying in patients with gastroparesis

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation between endoflip parameters and symptom severity
secondary_outcome.description: Correlate distensibility data (cross-sectional area, pressure, distensibility index) with severity of gastroparesis symptoms by Patient Assessment GI-Ssymptoms (PAGI-SYM)

intervention.description: Transnasal Esophageal manometry and Endoflip Balloon distensibility

study_pop.textblock: Study subjects will be recruited from patients who were referred by their physicians to the GI Motility Lab at IU University Hospital for esophageal manometry-impedance and/or EndoFLIP

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All patients who presented to GI Motility Lab at IU University Hospital for esophageal manometry-impedance and/or EndoFLIP
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age <18 yrs old
- Unable to communicate verbally with the staff

responsible_party.investigator_title: Director of Motility and Neurogastroenterology Unit
